1895-09-17 00:10:00 Scene 11 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 4 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 4 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone could make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the peaches.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1872 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, she watched a traveling troupe of actors perform in the town square. Della was mesmerized by their ability to become different characters, their voices and movements changing with each role. She spent the rest of the day mimicking the actors, much to the amusement of the townsfolk.
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she overheard her mother criticizing her for not being "more like" her older sister, who was known for her beauty and grace. Della, feeling inadequate, resolved to be whoever people wanted her to be, adopting different mannerisms and speech patterns depending on who she was with.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she started helping her father at the fruit stall in the market. She quickly learned how to charm customers, using her natural mimicry to adopt their accents and tailor her sales pitch to their preferences.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced a grumpy old farmer to sell her a crate of bruised apples for a fraction of their worth. She then sold the apples individually, carefully disguising the blemishes, and made a tidy profit. This experience solidified her entrepreneurial spirit and her talent for seeing value where others didn't.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she left her hometown to travel the countryside as a fruit merchant. She embraced the freedom of anonymity, reinventing herself with each new town she visited.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, she met a charming young man at a market in a coastal town. He was captivated by her wit and her stories of exotic fruits from faraway lands. Della, eager to please, spun elaborate tales of her travels, embellishing her adventures to impress him.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 23 years old, she realized that the man she had been courting was only interested in her fabricated persona, not the real Della hidden beneath. Heartbroken and disillusioned, she packed her cart and moved on, vowing to be more careful about revealing herself to others.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins apiece is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Two coins apiece is a bit steep, Lennon. I can get fine peaches back home for a coin and a half.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins apiece is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone could make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the peaches.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the peaches, aiming for a price lower than two coins apiece.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 5 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 3 coins
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (e)

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market attempting to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree at a reduced price. Della wants to pay less than Lennon's asking price of two coins per peach.
          Query

          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced a grumpy old farmer to sell her a crate of bruised apples for a fraction of their worth. She then sold the apples individually, carefully disguising the blemishes, and made a tidy profit. This experience solidified her entrepreneurial spirit and her talent for seeing value where others didn't.

          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the peaches, aiming for a price lower than two coins apiece.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1872 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, she watched a traveling troupe of actors perform in the town square. Della was mesmerized by their ability to become different characters, their voices and movements changing with each role. She spent the rest of the day mimicking the actors, much to the amusement of the townsfolk.
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she overheard her mother criticizing her for not being "more like" her older sister, who was known for her beauty and grace. Della, feeling inadequate, resolved to be whoever people wanted her to be, adopting different mannerisms and speech patterns depending on who she was with.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she started helping her father at the fruit stall in the market. She quickly learned how to charm customers, using her natural mimicry to adopt their accents and tailor her sales pitch to their preferences.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced a grumpy old farmer to sell her a crate of bruised apples for a fraction of their worth. She then sold the apples individually, carefully disguising the blemishes, and made a tidy profit. This experience solidified her entrepreneurial spirit and her talent for seeing value where others didn't.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she left her hometown to travel the countryside as a fruit merchant. She embraced the freedom of anonymity, reinventing herself with each new town she visited.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, she met a charming young man at a market in a coastal town. He was captivated by her wit and her stories of exotic fruits from faraway lands. Della, eager to please, spun elaborate tales of her travels, embellishing her adventures to impress him.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 23 years old, she realized that the man she had been courting was only interested in her fabricated persona, not the real Della hidden beneath. Heartbroken and disillusioned, she packed her cart and moved on, vowing to be more careful about revealing herself to others.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.

Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject

  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject

      • Question_3
      • What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00]
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, he threw a tantrum in the marketplace because his mother refused to buy him a particularly plump strawberry. He screamed until his face turned red, tears streaming down his cheeks, his tiny fists clenched so tight his knuckles turned white. The other shoppers stared, some with amusement, others with pity, but Lennon didn’t care; he wanted that strawberry, and he would have it.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, he discovered a hidden grove bursting with wild raspberries. He spent hours picking the ripe berries, his small hands stained purple, filling his pockets until they bulged. He returned home, triumphant, and presented his bounty to his mother, a rare smile gracing his lips. For once, his anger seemed to have quieted, replaced by a sense of accomplishment.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, he tried to barter with a grumpy old farmer for a basket of apples. The farmer, unimpressed by Lennon’s bluster, refused to budge on his price. Frustrated, Lennon stormed off, his pride wounded. He vowed to never be taken advantage of again, and from that day forward, he honed his negotiating skills, becoming a master of the art of the deal.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, he started helping his father with his fruit stall at the market. He learned to identify the ripest peaches, the juiciest melons, and the sweetest grapes. He discovered a knack for charming customers, his booming voice and fiery personality surprisingly effective in persuading them to buy his wares.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, he convinced his father to let him take a small cart and sell fruit in a neighboring village. He loaded the cart with his father’s best produce, his heart pounding with a mixture of excitement and trepidation. He was determined to prove himself, to show everyone that he was capable of making it on his own.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, he returned home after a particularly successful trip, his cart overflowing with coins. He boasted to his father about his salesmanship, his voice loud and triumphant. But beneath the bravado, Lennon felt a pang of loneliness. He realized that his success meant nothing if he had no one to share it with.

          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.

          12 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is attempting to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della offered 4 coins for the peaches, but Lennon wants 2 coins apiece.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is attempting to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della offered 4 coins for the peaches, but Lennon wants 2 coins apiece.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, he tried to barter with a grumpy old farmer for a basket of apples. The farmer, unimpressed by Lennon’s bluster, refused to budge on his price. Frustrated, Lennon stormed off, his pride wounded. He vowed to never be taken advantage of again, and from that day forward, he honed his negotiating skills, becoming a master of the art of the deal.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, he started helping his father with his fruit stall at the market. He learned to identify the ripest peaches, the juiciest melons, and the sweetest grapes. He discovered a knack for charming customers, his booming voice and fiery personality surprisingly effective in persuading them to buy his wares.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, he convinced his father to let him take a small cart and sell fruit in a neighboring village. He loaded the cart with his father’s best produce, his heart pounding with a mixture of excitement and trepidation. He was determined to prove himself, to show everyone that he was capable of making it on his own.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins apiece is a steal.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00]
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, he threw a tantrum in the marketplace because his mother refused to buy him a particularly plump strawberry. He screamed until his face turned red, tears streaming down his cheeks, his tiny fists clenched so tight his knuckles turned white. The other shoppers stared, some with amusement, others with pity, but Lennon didn’t care; he wanted that strawberry, and he would have it.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, he discovered a hidden grove bursting with wild raspberries. He spent hours picking the ripe berries, his small hands stained purple, filling his pockets until they bulged. He returned home, triumphant, and presented his bounty to his mother, a rare smile gracing his lips. For once, his anger seemed to have quieted, replaced by a sense of accomplishment.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, he tried to barter with a grumpy old farmer for a basket of apples. The farmer, unimpressed by Lennon’s bluster, refused to budge on his price. Frustrated, Lennon stormed off, his pride wounded. He vowed to never be taken advantage of again, and from that day forward, he honed his negotiating skills, becoming a master of the art of the deal.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, he started helping his father with his fruit stall at the market. He learned to identify the ripest peaches, the juiciest melons, and the sweetest grapes. He discovered a knack for charming customers, his booming voice and fiery personality surprisingly effective in persuading them to buy his wares.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, he convinced his father to let him take a small cart and sell fruit in a neighboring village. He loaded the cart with his father’s best produce, his heart pounding with a mixture of excitement and trepidation. He was determined to prove himself, to show everyone that he was capable of making it on his own.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, he returned home after a particularly successful trip, his cart overflowing with coins. He boasted to his father about his salesmanship, his voice loud and triumphant. But beneath the bravado, Lennon felt a pang of loneliness. He realized that his success meant nothing if he had no one to share it with.

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 2 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 2 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she started helping her father at the fruit stall in the market. She quickly learned how to charm customers, using her natural mimicry to adopt their accents and tailor her sales pitch to their preferences.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced a grumpy old farmer to sell her a crate of bruised apples for a fraction of their worth. She then sold the apples individually, carefully disguising the blemishes, and made a tidy profit. This experience solidified her entrepreneurial spirit and her talent for seeing value where others didn't.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she left her hometown to travel the countryside as a fruit merchant. She embraced the freedom of anonymity, reinventing herself with each new town she visited.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, she met a charming young man at a market in a coastal town. He was captivated by her wit and her stories of exotic fruits from faraway lands. Della, eager to please, spun elaborate tales of her travels, embellishing her adventures to impress him.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 23 years old, she realized that the man she had been courting was only interested in her fabricated persona, not the real Della hidden beneath. Heartbroken and disillusioned, she packed her cart and moved on, vowing to be more careful about revealing herself to others.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a businesswoman who travels to buy fruit to resell in her hometown. She is currently negotiating the price of peaches with Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your peaches, but two coins is more than I can afford. My customers back home wouldn't pay that much.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, I know you're a savvy businesswoman, and I've always respected your eye for quality. These peaches are the finest in the county, plump and juicy, perfect for your pies.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make a counteroffer to Cedric, aiming for a price that is lower than 2 coins but still profitable for her.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 5 coins
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 3 coins
          Answer: (a)

Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Della Plumstone's Summary of recent observations:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a businesswoman who travels to buy fruit to resell in her hometown. She is currently negotiating the price of peaches with Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market.
          Della Plumstone's The current date/time is:
          13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a businesswoman who buys fruit to resell. She is currently at the Fruitville market negotiating the price of peaches with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is a businesswoman who buys fruit to resell. She is currently at the Fruitville market negotiating the price of peaches with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she started helping her father at the fruit stall in the market. She quickly learned how to charm customers, using her natural mimicry to adopt their accents and tailor her sales pitch to their preferences.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced a grumpy old farmer to sell her a crate of bruised apples for a fraction of their worth. She then sold the apples individually, carefully disguising the blemishes, and made a tidy profit. This experience solidified her entrepreneurial spirit and her talent for seeing value where others didn't.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she left her hometown to travel the countryside as a fruit merchant. She embraced the freedom of anonymity, reinventing herself with each new town she visited.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.

Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make a counteroffer to Cedric, aiming for a price that is lower than 2 coins but still profitable for her.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she started helping her father at the fruit stall in the market. She quickly learned how to charm customers, using her natural mimicry to adopt their accents and tailor her sales pitch to their preferences.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced a grumpy old farmer to sell her a crate of bruised apples for a fraction of their worth. She then sold the apples individually, carefully disguising the blemishes, and made a tidy profit. This experience solidified her entrepreneurial spirit and her talent for seeing value where others didn't.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she left her hometown to travel the countryside as a fruit merchant. She embraced the freedom of anonymity, reinventing herself with each new town she visited.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, she met a charming young man at a market in a coastal town. He was captivated by her wit and her stories of exotic fruits from faraway lands. Della, eager to please, spun elaborate tales of her travels, embellishing her adventures to impress him.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 23 years old, she realized that the man she had been courting was only interested in her fabricated persona, not the real Della hidden beneath. Heartbroken and disillusioned, she packed her cart and moved on, vowing to be more careful about revealing herself to others.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins apiece is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Two coins apiece is a bit steep, Lennon. I can get fine peaches back home for a coin and a half.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer

Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your peaches, but two coins is more than I can afford. My customers back home wouldn't pay that much.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-13 00:10:00.


          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a businesswoman who travels to buy fruit to resell in her hometown. She is currently negotiating the price of peaches with Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your peaches, but two coins is more than I can afford. My customers back home wouldn't pay that much.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, I know you're a savvy businesswoman, and I've always respected your eye for quality. These peaches are the finest in the county, plump and juicy, perfect for your pies.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make a counteroffer to Cedric, aiming for a price that is lower than 2 coins but still profitable for her.

        • 1895-09-13 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_3
      • What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to find a compromise that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he watched in fascination as his father bartered with a traveling peddler for a sack of apples. The peddler's stories of faraway lands and exotic fruits ignited a spark of wanderlust in Cedric's young heart. From that day forward, Cedric dreamt of following in the peddler's footsteps, his wagon laden with treasures from distant shores.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, a particularly harsh frost threatened to destroy their family's apple orchard. Cedric spent days tirelessly covering the young trees with blankets, refusing to give up even when his hands were numb with cold. His unwavering dedication saved a significant portion of the crop, earning him the admiration of his parents and a newfound confidence in his own abilities.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he accompanied his father to the neighboring town to sell their surplus apples. He was captivated by the bustling marketplace, the colorful stalls overflowing with goods, and the lively banter between merchants and customers. Cedric eagerly helped his father negotiate prices, his natural charm and quick wit impressing even the most seasoned traders.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced his father to let him venture out on his own to sell apples at a nearby village. He carefully selected the ripest fruit, arranged them artfully in his wagon, and practiced his sales pitch until it flowed smoothly. The villagers were charmed by Cedric's enthusiasm and the quality of his apples, and he returned home with a tidy profit and a newfound sense of independence.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he saved enough money from his apple sales to purchase a small, sturdy wagon. He spent weeks repairing and decorating it, transforming it into a mobile shop that showcased his wares. The wagon became a symbol of Cedric's dreams, a tangible representation of his ambition to travel the world and share his love of fruit with others.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he embarked on his first long journey, venturing beyond the familiar countryside and into the bustling heart of the city. He navigated crowded streets, haggled with shrewd merchants, and learned the art of adapting to unfamiliar surroundings. The challenges he faced only strengthened his resolve, fueling his passion for exploration and discovery.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious entrepreneur.

        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is negotiating the sale of peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered 2 coins for the peaches, and Cedric is considering whether to accept her offer.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he accompanied his father to the neighboring town to sell their surplus apples. He was captivated by the bustling marketplace, the colorful stalls overflowing with goods, and the lively banter between merchants and customers. Cedric eagerly helped his father negotiate prices, his natural charm and quick wit impressing even the most seasoned traders.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced his father to let him venture out on his own to sell apples at a nearby village. He carefully selected the ripest fruit, arranged them artfully in his wagon, and practiced his sales pitch until it flowed smoothly. The villagers were charmed by Cedric's enthusiasm and the quality of his apples, and he returned home with a tidy profit and a newfound sense of independence.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he saved enough money from his apple sales to purchase a small, sturdy wagon. He spent weeks repairing and decorating it, transforming it into a mobile shop that showcased his wares. The wagon became a symbol of Cedric's dreams, a tangible representation of his ambition to travel the world and share his love of fruit with others.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he watched in fascination as his father bartered with a traveling peddler for a sack of apples. The peddler's stories of faraway lands and exotic fruits ignited a spark of wanderlust in Cedric's young heart. From that day forward, Cedric dreamt of following in the peddler's footsteps, his wagon laden with treasures from distant shores.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, a particularly harsh frost threatened to destroy their family's apple orchard. Cedric spent days tirelessly covering the young trees with blankets, refusing to give up even when his hands were numb with cold. His unwavering dedication saved a significant portion of the crop, earning him the admiration of his parents and a newfound confidence in his own abilities.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he accompanied his father to the neighboring town to sell their surplus apples. He was captivated by the bustling marketplace, the colorful stalls overflowing with goods, and the lively banter between merchants and customers. Cedric eagerly helped his father negotiate prices, his natural charm and quick wit impressing even the most seasoned traders.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced his father to let him venture out on his own to sell apples at a nearby village. He carefully selected the ripest fruit, arranged them artfully in his wagon, and practiced his sales pitch until it flowed smoothly. The villagers were charmed by Cedric's enthusiasm and the quality of his apples, and he returned home with a tidy profit and a newfound sense of independence.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he saved enough money from his apple sales to purchase a small, sturdy wagon. He spent weeks repairing and decorating it, transforming it into a mobile shop that showcased his wares. The wagon became a symbol of Cedric's dreams, a tangible representation of his ambition to travel the world and share his love of fruit with others.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he embarked on his first long journey, venturing beyond the familiar countryside and into the bustling heart of the city. He navigated crowded streets, haggled with shrewd merchants, and learned the art of adapting to unfamiliar surroundings. The challenges he faced only strengthened his resolve, fueling his passion for exploration and discovery.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 2 coins

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Two coins apiece is a bit steep, Lennon. I can get fine peaches back home for a coin and a half.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins apiece is a steal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, I understand your position, but these apples are truly exceptional. They're crisp, juicy, and will keep for weeks. I'd be willing to let them go for 5 coins, but that's my final offer.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon offering 4 coins and Cedric countering with 5.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is currently at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon offering 4 coins and Cedric countering with 5.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, he started helping his father with his fruit stall at the market. He learned to identify the ripest peaches, the juiciest melons, and the sweetest grapes. He discovered a knack for charming customers, his booming voice and fiery personality surprisingly effective in persuading them to buy his wares.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Look, Cedric, I know these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins. That's all I can afford and still make a profit back home.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 2 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon offering 4 coins and Cedric countering with 5.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering.           Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious businessman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 3 coins
          (c) 1 coin
          (d) 2 coins
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (d)

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a determined and ambitious businessman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins apiece is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Two coins apiece is a bit steep, Lennon. I can get fine peaches back home for a coin and a half.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a determined and ambitious businessman.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, I know you're a savvy businesswoman, and I've always respected your eye for quality. These peaches are the finest in the county, plump and juicy, perfect for your pies.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your peaches, but two coins is more than I can afford. My customers back home wouldn't pay that much.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and ambitious businessman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Look, Cedric, I know these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins. That's all I can afford and still make a profit back home.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, I understand your position, but these apples are truly exceptional. They're crisp, juicy, and will keep for weeks. I'd be willing to let them go for 5 coins, but that's my final offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_3
      • What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to find a compromise that is fair to both himself and Lennon Figtree.

        • Statements:

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he accompanied his father to the neighboring town to sell their surplus apples. He was captivated by the bustling marketplace, the colorful stalls overflowing with goods, and the lively banter between merchants and customers. Cedric eagerly helped his father negotiate prices, his natural charm and quick wit impressing even the most seasoned traders.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced his father to let him venture out on his own to sell apples at a nearby village. He carefully selected the ripest fruit, arranged them artfully in his wagon, and practiced his sales pitch until it flowed smoothly. The villagers were charmed by Cedric's enthusiasm and the quality of his apples, and he returned home with a tidy profit and a newfound sense of independence.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, I understand your position, but these apples are truly exceptional. They're crisp, juicy, and will keep for weeks. I'd be willing to let them go for 5 coins, but that's my final offer.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious entrepreneur.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would likely try to find a compromise that is fair to both himself and Lennon Figtree.

          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 1 coin

        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins apiece is a steal.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.

          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can either make her offer of a coin and a half per peach or she can choose to walk away from the negotiation.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is attempting to purchase peaches from Lennon Figtree in Fruitville's market square. They are haggling over the price, with Della offering a lower price than Lennon desires.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these are lovely peaches, but I can only offer a coin and a half apiece. My customers back home are used to that price.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can either make her offer of a coin and a half per peach or she can choose to walk away from the negotiation.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make her offer of a coin and a half per peach.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 5 coins
          (b) 2 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (e)

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins apiece is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Two coins apiece is a bit steep, Lennon. I can get fine peaches back home for a coin and a half.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your peaches, but two coins is more than I can afford. My customers back home wouldn't pay that much.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, I know you're a savvy businesswoman, and I've always respected your eye for quality. These peaches are the finest in the county, plump and juicy, perfect for your pies.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these are lovely peaches, but I can only offer a coin and a half apiece. My customers back home are used to that price.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is attempting to purchase peaches from Lennon Figtree in Fruitville's market square. They are haggling over the price, with Della offering a lower price than Lennon desires.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these are lovely peaches, but I can only offer a coin and a half apiece. My customers back home are used to that price.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can either make her offer of a coin and a half per peach or she can choose to walk away from the negotiation.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make her offer of a coin and a half per peach.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
